Add a Category

  • Docs
  • Guides
  • Getting Started
  • Add a Category

Categories are used to classify your expenses. They act as a folder that stores many expenses. This is due to the one-to-many relationship between categories and expenses.

This relationship means that one category can have multiple expenses, but each expense can only have one category. In addition to this, you are unable to add expenses until you have created at least one category.

A simplified version of this relationship can be seen on the left.

Ways To Add A Category

You can add categories in 2 different ways. The first way, option A, is to click the '+' shortcut in the upper-right corner of the Categories section.

Alternatively, using option B, you can click the "Add New Category" button in the Categories list. By selecting either of these options, a pop-up column will open on the left side. In this column, you can add the desired data for a category.

Category Options

To create a category, you must enter the Name, a Description, and select a unique Icon.

To learn more about each option, select it from the menu below:

The name is a user-friendly name that will be associated with the category. The name must be 20 characters or less. This name will be displayed in the Category Breakdown as well as in the associated expenses. This setting can be changed at a later date.
The description is a short couple sentence that describes the category. The description must be 255 characters or less. This description will only be available when selecting a category from the Categories section. This setting can be changed at a later date.
The icon is a minimalistic icon that will represent the category. We offer a large selection of 50+ icons ranging from tools to hot air balloons. This icon will be displayed alongside the category name in the Categories section as well as in the legend of the Category Breakdown. This setting can be changed at a later date.

Once this information has been entered, the 'Add Category' button can be pressed. Please know that when a category is added or updated, all category-related filters are cleared.
